column4: is there a way to force mount a harddrive after an unclean shutdown?????
if you are refering to a NTFS filesystem . yes.. theres the -o force option to the ntfs-3g command that can force it to mount
what would the command be if linux sees it as say, /dev/sda1
sudo ntf-3g /dev/sda1 /media/whatever -o force    Or similer.. check the ntfs-3g man page/guides for other options you may want to use
